items.content:
#â€‹534 â€” April 16, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Comparing the New Generation of Build Tools â€” A detailed evaluation of a variety of approaches for bundling JavaScript and other front-end assets, including Snowpack, esbuild, Vite, and wmr. A handyÂ overview.

Hugh Haworth

Slow and Steady: Converting Sentryâ€™s Entire Frontend toÂ TypeScript â€” Dozens of developers took a year to convert 1,100 files and 95,000 lines of code from JavaScript to TypeScript. This is one of those â€œwe did a complicated thing and hereâ€™s what we learntâ€ pieces youâ€™ll want to point to if your workplace attempts a similarÂ thing.

Priscila Oliveira and Mark Story (Sentry)

Get to Know Chromeâ€™s Dev Tools â€” Join Jon Kuperman for this introduction to Googleâ€™s Chrome Developer Tools. Youâ€™ll learn how to edit, debug and profile you web apps in this detailed videoÂ course.

Frontend Masters sponsor

15 DevTool Secrets for JavaScript Developers â€” I think â€˜secretsâ€™ is a bit bold, but nonetheless I picked up a few tips here. Breaking on DOM changes, filtering requests in the Network panel, and copying requests in fetch or curl format are all veryÂ neat.

Craig Buckler

ğŸ¤ It must be the season for thinking about the DevTools as the Syntax.fm podcast did an episode explaining the DevTools tabs too.

Quick Bits

  • There's a new sub-Reddit called /r/JSdev aiming to foster JavaScript orientedÂ discussions.
  • Looking for a job? Emma Bostian has a great write up of seven mistakes to avoid in your next technicalÂ interview.
  • The Cloudflare Workers serverless system runs on V8 but not Node.js exactly but now boasts Node.js support if you want to use (many of the) existing Node packages you know and love. Workers also just gained WebSocketsÂ support.

Releases

D3.js 6.7.0 â€” Data visualization toolkit.
eslint-plugin-vue 7.9.0 â€” ESLint plugin for Vue.js.
react-markdown 6.0 â€” Markdown component for React.
pnpm 6.1.0 â€” Alternative 'disk space efficient' package manager.
Cypress 7.1 â€” Testing for anything that runs in a browser.

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

A Thorough Guide to Working with Strings in Modern JavaScript â€” A well presented suite of examples showing off numerous string manipulation techniques from how template literals work to joining, comparing, and searching throughÂ strings.

Dave J Saunders

Hyperapp â€“ Is It a Lightweight 'React Killer'? â€” There are lots of frameworks which aspire to chip away at Reactâ€™s market position. After an ecosystem setback when breaking changes were introduced in v2, Hyperapp is back and its claimed benefits warrant another look.

Arek Nawo

A Simple Start to ES Modules in Node.js â€” Once Node 10 shuffles away later this month, every supported Node release will support ES modules in addition to CommonJS. If you havenâ€™t dipped a toe in the ESM water yet, Kent keeps it simple and straightforward with an exampleÂ here.

Kent C Dodds

You Build the App, Weâ€™ll Parse the Logs â€” Send logs from your Node.js and JavaScript apps to LogDNA. Weâ€™ll parse them so you can search and take action in realÂ time.

LogDNA sponsor

An Introduction to the switch(true) Pattern â€” SeÃ¡n likes it, but Iâ€™m not so sure. Itâ€™s an interesting way to manage a complex set of conditionalsÂ though.

SeÃ¡n Barry

How to Send Tweets with a JavaScript GitHub Action â€” Learn how to create a GitHub action which sends a tweet whenever a pull request isÂ merged.

James Hibbard

A Real World CSS vs. CSS-in-JS Performance Comparison â€” No huge surprise here, IÂ suspect.

Tomas Pustelnik

Building a Video Streaming App with Nuxt.js, Node and Express â€” A walkthrough of creating a server-side Node app that will handle the fetching and streaming of videos, generating thumbnails, and serving captions and subtitles. Nuxt.js is the Vue.js based framework that brings it allÂ together.

Deven Rathore

Book a Demo. Ship Fast. Rest Easy. LaunchDarkly â€” Testing in production? It's scary until it's not. Control your code. Ship fast. Reduce risk. Reclaim yourÂ life.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

â–¶Â Â Building an ASCII Game Engine That Runs in the Browser â€” One of the best JavaScript YouTubers moves into a little bit of game development. If recreating Dwarf Fortress is on your bucket list, you might enjoyÂ this.

Low Level JavaScript

Going â€œMeta GSAPâ€: The Quest for â€œPerfectâ€ Infinite Scrolling
Jhey Tompkins

Tricking TypeScript Into Typing Untyped JavaScript Modules
Kamran Ayub

JS Classes Are Not â€œJust Syntactic Sugarâ€
Andrea Giammarchi

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Deno 1.9 Released â€” Node's anagrammed cousin continues to get even better. 1.9 brings a native HTTP/2-compliant Web server (which seems to beat Node's in basic benchmarks), support for blob and data URLs, faster interop with the underlying Rust code, and more. "Why use Deno," you ask? Think V8, but with the layer on top built in Rust, with a focus on extra security, first class TypeScript support, and offering browser-compatible APIs whereverÂ possible.

The Deno Team

Announcing react-pdf v2.0 â€” While it remains backward-compatible with v1, the new version of react-pdf is a complete reimplementation from scratch. It offers a new hook-based API, improved performance, SVG support, and support for more CSS properties including z-index and overflow.

Diego Muracciole

Automate Code Standard Enforcement with Lightweight StaticÂ Analysis

Semgrep sponsor

party.js: A Way to 'Brighten Up' Your Site with Visual Effects â€” Back in the late 90s and early 00s, JavaScript was very commonly used to add â€˜sparkleâ€™ to Web sites in the form of snow, unusual cursors, and such. This is in much the same spirit. Support varies but itâ€™s presentedÂ well.

YilianSource

Algolia Search API Client for JavaScript â€” An official, fully featured low-level client for interacting with Algolia, a popular search API. Works in both the browser and onÂ Node.

Algolia

jest-puppeteer 5.0: Run Your Tests using Jest and Puppeteer

Smooth Code

# 533 â€” April 9, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Healing Power of JavaScript â€” There wasnâ€™t a singular â€œbigâ€ bit of news this week, but why not something a little more whimsical? Craig Mod, a popular writer and photographer, has written a piece for WIRED about how, for Craig, â€œcode is therapy, an escape and a path to hope in a troubledÂ world.â€

Craig Mod

ğŸ“– Â The ES2021 Edition â€œJavaScript for Impatient Programmersâ€ â€” Dr. Axel has updated his popular JavaScript for Impatient Programmers book to ES2021 standards and you can still read the (nearly) whole book online.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Connect Code to Customer in This Free Webinar Deep-Dive â€” Developers have become integral to the success of every business â€“ because if your software sucks, your business sucks. In this live demo, we'll show you three successful strategies that put the customer at the center of your monitoringÂ workflow.

Raygun sponsor

Vanilla JavaScript Code Snippets â€” A roundup of a number of useful sources when you want to keep your JavaScript simple and light and as vanilla as possible. Covers things like 1loc.dev, Micro.js and 30 seconds of code.

Vitaly Friedman

Five Ways to Prevent Code Injection in JavaScript â€” You never want malicious users to be able to send code over the wire that then gets run by your own program. Here are some ways to prevent thisÂ problem.

Liran Tal

Quick Bits

  • The Vue project has decided to not support IE11 with Vue 3 â€” instead, numerous features will be backported to Vue 2.
  • Node saw a swathe of security releases this week to fix a few high severity issues, mostly in the OpenSSL dependency.
  • The Chrome DevTools team have continued to write about how they're migrating the tools over to using TypeScript. They've previously written similarly about Puppeteer too.
  • React Summit returns (remotely) next week. We've got some tickets to give away onÂ Twitter.

Releases

Cucumber.js 7.1.0 â€” Write tests as stories.
Fabric.js 4.4 â€” Work with canvases from JS.
NSFW.js 2.4 â€” Client-side NSFW image detection.
Node CSV 5.5 â€” Full featured CSV parser.
Marko 5.7 â€” eBay's UI library.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Front-End Senior Software Engineer (Remote) â€” Help power a platform meaningfully changing how journalists, PR pros, and marketers around the worldÂ work.

Muck Rack

Senior Software Engineering Consultant - [100% Remote]Â  â€” Co-founded by Justin Searls,Â Test Double is an engineering consultancy on a mission to improve the way the world builds software. Work on challenging projects with a collaborative, passionate team. 100% employee owned, contract and full-time rolesÂ available.

TestDouble

Find Software Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Take 5 minutes to build your free profile & start getting interviews for your next job. Companies on Hired are actively hiring rightÂ now.

Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

#532 â€” April 2, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Deno Gets a Company, Some Money, and a DistributedÂ VM â€” The folks behind Deno (the secure JS/TS runtime project founded by the original creator of Node.js) have raised $4.9m and formed a company to help push it further forward, including plans to hire more full-timeÂ engineers. They've also unveiled Deno Deploy, a 'globally distributed JavaScript VM' of sorts. Exciting times are afoot forÂ them.

Ryan Dahl, Bert Belder

Announcing TypeScript 4.3 Beta â€” It dropped on April 1 but it was no joke. Notably, 4.3 introduces a override keyword to make it clear when youâ€™re overriding a method rather than adding a new one. There are also template string type improvements, and methods and accessors can be given #privateÂ names.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

How to Model JSON to Get the Most Out of Your Document Database â€” Thinking about using a document database for your next project? The flexible data model is a major plus, but having so many options can be intimidating at first. This free virtual event will help you make all the right choices. RegisterÂ here.

Couchbase sponsor

NativeScript 8.0 Released â€” NativeScript is a mature framework for building iOS and Android apps that lets you use native APIs directly from JavaScript (or TypeScript) â€“ itâ€™s agnostic so you can use Angular, React, Vue or Svelte with it too. 8.0 adds webpack5 support, Apple Silicon (M1) support, improved accessibility, andÂ more.

OpenJS Foundation

Tagify 4.0: An Elegant Input Component for Tags â€” The polished demos show a lot of effort has been put in here. GitHubÂ repo.

Yair Even-Or

Quick Bits

  • Component development environment Storybook 6.2 has been released with Vue 3, webpack 5, and ESBuild support, plus a new JSONÂ editor.
  • In the April Fools' department came ES1995, a polyfill for 'super-modern'Â JavaScript.

Ivan Tanev

A Look at Class static Initializer Blocks in V8 9.1 â€” Sure, it looks a little Java-y, but this new syntax gives you a defined place to put code that runs just once for a defined class. Expect this in Chrome 91 (and therefore V8 9.1, weÂ assume).

Shu-yu Guo

How to Build a Financial Dashboard with React â€” In this tutorial, we'll build a financial dashboard from scratch & learn a bit about CSS grid, KendoReact, andÂ theming.

Progress KendoReact sponsor

On JavaScript Closures â€” The more advanced JS developers among you can skip this, but Kent quickly covers some useful points about closuresÂ here.

Kent C Dodds

â–¶Â Â Discussing Skypack and Snowpack with Fred Schott â€” Yes, this is a Ruby podcast, but I find a more detached, 30,000 foot view of something as game changing as Snowpack useful in order to put it inÂ context.

Remote Ruby Podcast podcast

Getting Started with React and D3.js â€” If you have been putting off incorporating D3 into your projects because of the visualization libraryâ€™s reputation for being difficult to learn, hereâ€™s a well-paced (and somehow beautiful!) intro to get your efforts underway.

Future Corp

d3-graphviz 4.0: D3-Powered Graphviz DOT Graph Rendering â€” Renders SVGs from DOT-defined graphs by way of a WebAssembly port of Graphviz, including animated transitions. Todayâ€™s 4.0 release brings it up to D3.js 6.0Â standards.
